lenders.name: Carlton
lenders.loan_because: My family an I are proud to be Americans.  As such we respect our good fortune and seek, as good world citizens, to make a difference for those less fortunate.  We have been to nearly 50 countries and are currently publishing a book (www.portraitsofourworld.com) to raise money to build schools in Africa as well.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a family of photographers who enjoy sharing the hope and dreams of people around the world.

lenders.name: Jeremy
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed.

lenders.name: Pamela
lenders.loan_because: A little money from each of us goes a long way to help those who are helping themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a family lawyer

lenders.name: Diane
lenders.loan_because: How can I not loan when you see how little can make such a big difference
lenders.occupational_info: I do accounting work for small businesses-lots of numbers in my life!

lenders.name: Daryl
lenders.loan_because: I am in business for myself and know how hard it can be to raise capital  to expand a business venture. I enjoy helping others that want to succeed.

lenders.name: Becky
lenders.loan_because: I lived in a developing country for 33 months.  I was "living poor" at the time. The people, with their limited resources, were so incredibly good to me. Now I am able to financially help others and be part of a larger group that can make a difference.

lenders.name: Dave
lenders.loan_because: we live in a world of drastic inequity where the  few enjoy control over-- and the ability to share--so many resources.

lenders.name: Caryn
lenders.loan_because: I want to be able to help others around the world who are not as fortunate as I am.
lenders.occupational_info: Dog-walker, Dog obedience trainer, consultant

lenders.name: Jim
lenders.loan_because: my daughter gave this as a gift.

lenders.name: mithal family
lenders.loan_because: To change lives of people i.e. ensuring that no one is left behind in basic health care, having basic education, and having basic needs.

lenders.name: Joseph
lenders.loan_because: I  have a strong belief in helping people to get started or improve their ability to support themselves.  The classic "give a man a fish vs teach him to fish" mentality.  This is a great idea that needs word of mouth support.
lenders.occupational_info: I drive a city bus in Tucson, Arizona, not any different then bus drivers anywhere in the world.

lenders.name: Tom & Mariam
lenders.loan_because: We want to make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Martijn
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the Kiva initiative, making it more accessible through digital communication to offer support to people far away in a simple yet profound way.
lenders.occupational_info: I make computer games, websites and digital graphics.

lenders.name: Lisa
lenders.loan_because: I believe this is one of the better ways to truly help others:  to help them help themselves.  God has blessed me, and I want to be a blessing to others, too.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a project manager for a cause marketing consulting firm and I also am a Human Resources consultant, specializing in corporate benefits.  One day I'd love to make my living solely by producing independent films.

lenders.name: Lynne' (Njeri)
lenders.occupation: House wife and manage our nightly rental

lenders.name: Edith
lenders.loan_because: Personal involvement in microcredit seems like an ideal way to attack poverty.  And Kiva's pioneering use of the online social networking concept to deliver funds to individual business owners in developing countries is brilliant.  It builds a sense of connection across borders and cultures.  On April 1, 2008, I made my first second generation loan.  Thanks to the responsible payback by Mayra Palomino Del Aquila from Peru, the Hai Gam Group in Sudan had funds to support their business!  And on May 15, 2009, their loan was paid in full so a third generation loan could be made.  And now, August 16, 2009, I was able to make a new loan to Mayra Palomino to support the business she shares with her husband. On February 15, 2009, the first loan I ever made on Kiva was paid back in full by Chea Sophy in Cambodia.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in grant management services at the oldest public hospital in the U.S., Bellevue, and have always worked in public health.  My passion, though, is scubadiving, and in the past ten years I've traveled to many beautiful sites across the world to view the coral reefs.

lenders.name: Dirk
lenders.loan_because: We have to stick together!
lenders.occupational_info: I advise mobile phone network operators on how to become a little bit better every day. It's fun!

lenders.name: Sally
lenders.loan_because: To whom much is given, much is expected.

lenders.name: Neil
lenders.loan_because: I am lucky enough to be in a position to.  This is one great way to see your money benefit people all over the world - repeatedly.  It is constantly fascinating.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I believe in supporting people who work to improve their own life.
lenders.occupational_info: I help business managers learn how to improve their personal performance.

lenders.name: Joonas
lenders.loan_because: I have the opportunity.

lenders.name: IN MEMORY OF JSL
lenders.loan_because: There is no good reason not to do so.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm studying for a doctorate in Clinical Psychology. I want to work with youthful offenders and help them change their lives to become productive members of society.

lenders.occupational_info: I design packaging and logo's  (for cunsumer products) like boxes, labels and even manuals. I also do lay-outs for books and I am a (hobby) photografer.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired hospital head manager.

lenders.loan_because: a single mouth can never taste the sweetest honey.

lenders.occupational_info: I am very fortunate and grateful to live where I live, and due to the many opportunities and choices I have, I am in my third career. I am in the business of making women feel beautiful by taking care of their skin, their body, and their soul.

lenders.name: piyush
lenders.loan_because:
My name is PIYUSH BANERJEA. I am from India I am writting this to u all. pls read it.
I am  a simple person from India. Use to have a small leather business. I was happy in my own world. Was working with all honesty.Suddenly one day I got in touch with a person on net. He posed to be an importer of leather goods. He showed very keen interest in my Products. He was very professional. In two, three days intraction he asked me for sample. He was unknown to me. i tried to be smart and asked for advance. Without any hagitation he agreed. he gave me international postal money orders. he used some american address .I deposited the postal money orders to my  bank. In due course the bank cleared the money orders. It gave me strength to beleive him. I gave him the samples. later on he gave me bulk order for my goods and paid the amount by postal money orders. again the same procedure. i submitted-bank cleared it. but in the mean time he did one tricky thing. he increased the order . he gave me money in advance so i didn't have single doubt on him. I manufactured the goods from my own pocket. I was very happy . i was doing good. I shipped the goods to him. Then i started asking him for the balance payment but to my utter surprise he stopped receiving my call and not even gave any response to my emails.and suddenly after few time bank personal turned up to my place and asked me to return the money and the reason they gave me to do so was that the postal money order which i got from that person turned to be fake.. by knowing this earth slipped beneath my feets. I was in complete dark. bank  started legal action against me. later on I came to know that the person who gave me the postal money order was a Nigerian. i am totally ruined. Didn't have enough money to give a normal life to my wife and two kids.i am bound to repay the bank otherwise they will put me behind bars. Yes I am victim of NIGERIAN SCAMMERS. I am writting all this beacuse I need ur valuable support. I know life is not so easy. But for my fault my family members are not suppose to live like this.Money is very important for everyone. I just need little support from u all so that i can repay the bank. i don't have much time. You must be thinking that this is a new way to earn money but this is not true in this case.So i request u and all ur friends  for the sake of humanity pls help me .If u think that i am right then pls donate any amount to the below mentioned paypal id.your small help will do alot to my family.
 I am really very sorry for troubling u all. PLS trust me I am in need and thats why i am asking for help from u all. I know i am iritating u all. I don't have any other option but to ask for help from u all. I am not asking for big donation. just give me 300-500US$. I am begging to u all. this will help me to repay my debts and re-establish myself. I have no right to ask for money from u all but i don't have any other option. Just help this poor brahmin.

abhishal.s@rediffmail.com
this is my friend paypal id.
i am also providing my account details:

  Swift Code  : CHASUS33XXX 
(Intermediary bank) Bank Clearing Code : FED ABA 021000021 
        
For credit to:  Account Number : 400808595 USD

FOR FINAL CREDIT TO ICICI BANK KANPUR BRANCH A/C
NAME; PIYUSH BANERJEA
MY ACCOUNT NO.628801516827
BRANCH CODE: 6288

Piyush Banerjea

kanpur
India

lenders.occupational_info:
NewLeaf Chocolates is an online shop that provides the world's best premium chocolates in a sustainable way. We continuously affirm our commitment to the planet in these tangible ways: 
1) Offering a wide selection of organic and fair-trade bars, confections and drinking chocolate,
2) Shipping all chocolate in our sustainable GreenPod that uses only plant-based materials and
3) Donating a portion of all sales to the environment.
Visit our website at: www.newleafchocolates.com

lenders.occupational_info: I am engaged in the clothing industry, from designing to manufacturing to wholesaling and retailing...won many awards throughout North America and been in many magazines. Now beginning to Re Emerge back into industry on a global platform.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: It's easy to do, and a small amount of money goes a long way. Once you are paid back, you just loan it again to someone else. The gift that keeps on giving.

lenders.name: Ben
lenders.loan_because: this is a wonderful way to directly assist someone in the developing world.
lenders.occupational_info: Busily retired

lenders.name: Martha
lenders.loan_because: I have been so fortunate in my life to be able to borrow money when I wanted to expand my business so I would like to help other enterprising people help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell homes and land to various people and businesses.  I especially like to help young people find a way to finance their first home.

lenders.name: Sally
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance!
lenders.occupational_info: I take photographs of nature for the beauty and to share.

lenders.name: Jim & Debbie
lenders.loan_because: we want to do our part in making the world a better place for everyone.  When we reach out to help someone else, we both win.

lenders.name: Scott
lenders.loan_because: If I can help someone who really needs it, not just to give them money, but help them build a better life for themself, then that is the best gift I can give.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on computers for a University in Minnesota.

lenders.name: luqman

lenders.occupational_info: I work in Ghana,Africa.I do sell in a shop.I sell provisions ie:soap,milk,sugar etc.I need to expant my trade.

lenders.occupational_info: I develop software for Launch Control Systems at Kennedy Space Center, Florida. Braille is a 11th grade student.

lenders.name: Arjan

lenders.occupational_info: I have a plantation in Poland, where we grow Robinia trees which will be grown for 8 years and then used for stakes.

lenders.name: ted
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I help with securing a data network at a large University.

lenders.name: kath

lenders.occupational_info: internet project manager

lenders.occupational_info: I translate books from English to French, mostly on health, spirituality, personal growth, etc.

lenders.occupational_info: I'm a priest in the Episcopal Church.

lenders.loan_because: we each must do what we can to serve, love and support each other and that is true happiness.

lenders.loan_because: As a successful small business we are always looking for ways to give back to our local and global community. lenders.occupational_info: PADT, Inc. is a 50 person company made up of mostly engineers.  We use computer technology and aerospace engineering methods to help customers from around the world turn their ideas for products into devices that are strong, long-lasting and efficient.

lenders.name: Troy
lenders.occupational_info: Build technology products & companies

lenders.occupational_info: I work for Lockheed Martin, the world's largest defense contractor. I support internal programs/projects.

lenders.name: Judy T.

lenders.occupational_info: OB/GYN Nurse Practitioner: I provide maternity care and other medical services for women.

lenders.name: Tristin
lenders.loan_because: These people are trying hard to make it work. This shows you how easy it is to work together and help others out.

lenders.name: Sara
lenders.loan_because: I want to help other hard working people around the world.  Hopefully the loans bring more opportunities that they might not have otherwise.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a small company of 35 people.  My company sells/provides computer software to companies that provide telephone service to their customers.  My job is to help our new clients get setup and using our computer software.

lenders.name: DeAnna
lenders.loan_because:
"We get everything we want in life, by helping others get what they want."

It's not how much..but how many of us together.

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: I want to support the dreams of business men and women all over the world who are trying to make their jobs and lives better. lenders.occupational_info: I create software that allows vendors all over the world to market and sell their products on the internet.

lenders.name: Ashwin
lenders.loan_because: I can see that it makes a difference, and I know how much a little help means to a small business. A little of my money goes a very long way . When i travel to difeerent countries, I see how people live and manage. This encouraged me to be part of Kiva so I can help improve peoples lives

lenders.name: Stefanie
lenders.loan_because: I grew up in developing countries and have seen how a little help can go a long way, and I'm glad to finally find a way to really help people change their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a freelance writer.

lenders.name: KT

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: I have the financial means to do so and would like to possibly have a postive impact on someone's life.

lenders.name: Timo Traurig
lenders.loan_because: it helps
lenders.occupational_info: simly doing it

lenders.loan_because: There is joy in giving.   When you help otheres you help your self.
lenders.occupational_info: I adopted my two nephews.  They have made my life wonderful.

lenders.name: Ashley
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Lynn and Mike
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we care about people in poorer nations and we like to make a difference in someone's life. We particularly like giving to Ugandans because our church has a significant commitment in that country and physical and spiritual needs should be met.
lenders.occupational_info:
Lynn: I have recently graduated from college and am currently blessed to be teaching 1st grade--which I love!!
Mike: Travels the world looking for really neat products to sell to lucky South Texan shoppers.

lenders.name: Corey
lenders.loan_because: I'm always looking for gifts that will inspire meaning in people who are fortunate enough to have everything they need and more.  I just discovered Kiva gift certificates, and I am ordering them this year for friends and family members.  It is a wonderful way to celebrate our good lives, while honoring and supporting others and making the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm interested in green energy and clean technology, and working on a few startup initiatives.

lenders.name: Cathy
lenders.occupational_info: I teach young children with learning problems how to read.

lenders.name: bizzwriter
lenders.loan_because: Microloans are perhaps the best way that someone in the United States can have a measurable, positive, direct -- and long-lasting -- impact on the lives of people in developing countries.
lenders.occupational_info: I write business books, available in more than 20 languages, all around the world.

lenders.name: Tibo
lenders.loan_because: After traveling to many developing countries I've always wondered how I could efficiently help in a sustainable way those people full of energy and ambitions fulfill their dreams and support their families, without them always depending on the charity of others. With Kiva, I think that I have found it.
lenders.occupational_info: I am French, living in the Netherlands. I work for a large IT and software company.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: this is a powerful new tool in capital markets...

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because:
This poem says it perfectly: 

"There is a destiny that makes us brothers, no one goes his way alone. All that we send into the lives of others, comes back into our own."
lenders.occupational_info: I am a freelance writer that tries to educate and unite people from different backgrounds through humor and personal understanding.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: I want to encourage  new entrepreneurs.
lenders.occupational_info: I make factories more effective and productive.

lenders.name: M and Q
lenders.loan_because: Mom wants us to learn that there are many ways to make our world a better place (and make us better people in the process).

lenders.name: Tina
lenders.loan_because: I want a better life for everyone.
lenders.occupational_info: I process legal documents related to mortgage lending.

lenders.name: Rowan

lenders.occupational_info: I am one of several  Wiccan Priestesses of an established Coven.  We work together to heal ourselves, our environment and our great Mother Earth.

lenders.name: The Power of We
lenders.loan_because: simple things CAN change the world

lenders.name: AJ Smith
lenders.loan_because: it's the best way I know of to help put an end to the crushing poverty experienced by so many of earth's population. Secondly, I feel so lucky, as a woman, to have been born in the U.S. Women around the world who suffer so much discrimination deserve to have someone in their corner.
lenders.occupational_info: I spent 30 years teaching elementary-age children, and I loved my career. My favorite age to teach was 10-11 years old, and I enjoyed exploring books and science with all my classes

lenders.name: EmeraldCityCritterCare
lenders.loan_because: I want to help - from one small business owner to another.  :)

lenders.name: Marcus & Katherine
lenders.loan_because: Helping others realize their dreams is one way to achieve ours.

lenders.name: FaithWorks Project
lenders.loan_because: We want to empower emerging entrepreneurs globally and strengthen community development locally.
lenders.occupational_info: We seek to glorify God by being the connection between compassionate donors, forward-thinking microfinance institutions and innovative, local community development initiatives.

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: it feels good.

lenders.name: Deb
lenders.loan_because: I try to make the world a better place. Kiva loans are a small step in the right direction.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a small non-profit organization that helps older adults live safely and independently in their own homes for as long as possible.

lenders.name: Simon
lenders.loan_because: I care
lenders.occupational_info: I work for PayPal

lenders.name: Debbie
lenders.loan_because: Small loans make a BIG difference for hard-working people and families. I am very happy to find Kiva.org -- I want to help !
lenders.occupational_info: I work at home for 18 years doing research and writing for lawyers who represent coal mining companies.  We help to make electricity for the USA.

lenders.name: Ben
lenders.loan_because: I believe we each can change the world, and providing someone with economic assistance allows them to feel self worth but also makes sense because it generates their countries economy.

lenders.name: Leyla
lenders.loan_because: everyone needs a chance

lenders.name: Marbra
lenders.loan_because: We like the ability to make a direct impact and believe that microloans have this effect.

lenders.name: Lois & Sherwood
lenders.loan_because: what a wonderful way to help others to help themselves.    Poverty is the world's worst enemy.

lenders.name: Belinda
lenders.loan_because: I can (a little, anyway), and it's a good thing to do. I have lived in Mexico and worked at an orphanage in the USSR, and I know a little money can make a big difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English to foreign students at a university, and I love what I do. I feel very lucky.

lenders.name: Delfino
lenders.loan_because: it is vital for our planet's well-being to use our resources helping those who work for their families, communities and the environment, rather than helping corrupt governments & rich, international corporations.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an artist and a computer engineer, living in Seattle, USA.  I have traveled to many countries around the world, especially in Latin America, Asia and West Africa.

lenders.name: Andy
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea that what is a relatively small amount of money to me can make a big difference to someone else.  I also like that these are loans, not one-time donations.  Once repaid the money can be loaned out again!

lenders.name: Christina
lenders.loan_because: Even though I need the money that I have, others need it more than I do.
lenders.occupational_info: I test printers before they are sold, to make sure that they work okay.

lenders.name: Just Me
lenders.loan_because: we are all responsible

lenders.name: dani
lenders.loan_because: I need much money for my business
lenders.occupational_info: I am marketing stainless acesoris, I am looking for market in distric in indonesia and i want my acesoris can sel in the world like in asia state or uerope. In indonesia I always come to acesoris shop (departement store) and I need much money for my business.

lenders.name: Manu
lenders.loan_because: Because it makes so much sense and it is one excellent way to make a difference, at our one tiny level...Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: Giving feels good! I have been blessed by many riches and want to give back to my fellow human beings.

lenders.name: Tim
lenders.loan_because: I think this really works.
lenders.occupational_info: I used to work for international NGOs, and understand the challenges facing entrepreneurs in developing countries.  I'm also a former attorney, currently a consultant.

lenders.name: Cindy
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy it.

lenders.name: Douglas
lenders.loan_because: I was given a gift certificate.  That said, I believe microcredit is a crucial tool in eliminating poverty...

lenders.name: Erika
lenders.loan_because: I want to share my blessings and help others to be successful.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at a medical device company that makes life-saving equipment.

lenders.name: York
lenders.loan_because: I like to help others in need.  I also like the opportunity of feedback that the KIVA website gives us.
lenders.occupational_info: I work to keep the environment and water clean.

lenders.name: Brinn
lenders.loan_because: I can.  By eliminating one insignificant expenditure a week, I can help someone improve their life every week.  How could I not?

lenders.name: Cheryl & Chelsey
lenders.loan_because: In our own small way we hope to make a significant difference in someone's life.  Someone that we would never have the opportunity to cross paths with were it not for KIVA.

lenders.name: Ravi
lenders.loan_because: I believe that what to us is a little amount of money goes a long way to help others.  I also believe that a donation is like "feeding a man a fish"; it's nice, but it only lasts for a day.  A loan is like "teaching a man [or woman] to fish"; it lasts forever, and allows him or her to create a self-sustaining business that generates more cash flow and contributes to viable and sustainable economic growth in developing nations.  I also just love people from different countries and want to see them succeed!

lenders.name: Tish
lenders.loan_because: I can and I should, and I am so very happy to do it.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with people by trying to make the law useful and understandable to them.

lenders.name: Pentastudio Architecture
lenders.loan_because: We hope to assist people with small enterprises improve their abilities to provide for themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: We design healthy, creative environments for people working together -- architecture, interior design and graphics.

lenders.name: Leticia
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a Ph.D. student in biology.

lenders.name: Morgan Stanley PIF
lenders.loan_because:
Morgan Stanley gave us an opportunity to do something extraordinary for others. The Firm funded our team with an initial set of funds from which we would be able to execute our "Pay It Forward" idea.

For us, working in investment management, micro lending seemed like a fantastic opportunity. What's more, Kiva.org provided us with the best means with which to help others providing micro loans. Through Kiva.org we are able to see exactly where our money is being lent out to while being able to keep in contact with our borrowers.

We had 4 weeks to use this money to make a positive impact in our community. Our team looked to the global community. We took the time we were given, held some fundraisers and were able to raise our initial funding by 500%.

These funds are now loaned out of our non-withdrawable Kiva.org account.

lenders.name: Greenpaperinc
lenders.loan_because:
My work is to see that people most especialy mothers and children enjoy a good life on earth .
You look around you will see many parents who are suppose to wake up in the morning with a cheerfull spirit looking dull and you will ask what seems to be the problem.

Well from survey if the youths and mothers are able to get loans for business creation it will be a much happier world for the children and mothers.

I want to support my community by issuing loans to mothers and youths to set up businesses to support there daily life.
lenders.occupational_info: The Greenpaper Inc is a non governmental organization with Headquaters in  Abuja  Nigeria .We are participating in youths ,education and community development projects in local,national and international level of the globe for the good of the people.

lenders.name: Peter & Susan
lenders.loan_because: Why shouldn't we, who have so much, provide a helping hand - not a handout - to those not as lucky? Being born in the USA is, IMHO, a matter of luck.
lenders.occupational_info: We design schools, universities, hospitals & other buildings for clients throughout California. Susan works in Occupational Medicine, with people hurt on the job, and at a local Free Clinic.

lenders.name: hellohelllo
lenders.loan_because: I love helping other people!  My aunt made this account for me!  I love it!

lenders.name: Kelli
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power to change the world lies in the everyday relationships between people - the further you extend your reach to connect with others, the wider your networks become, the closer we all are, whatever our religion, culture, ethnicity, gender, or language
lenders.occupational_info: I seek to understand the way that culture influences our thoughts and actions - and how a better understanding of those cultures other than our own can provide solutions to political and social problems

lenders.name: Rebecca
lenders.loan_because:
"Be the change you wish to see in the world"  - Ghandi
That's why.
lenders.occupational_info: I educate the future of America and simultaneously (hopefully) open their eyes to  the world around them and hopefully help them realize what they can achieve and accomplish once they set their minds to it.  The students I teach are still at an impressionable age, but they're just learning to reason and comprehend adult topics and situations.  I love each and every one of them as if they were my own.  I could not imagine doing anything else.

lenders.name: Dicey
lenders.loan_because: Helping others makes me feel good!  I believe that, by working together with a global vision, we can each make a difference and have a positive impact on the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the research and development of pharmaceutical and biological drugs.

lenders.name: tricia
lenders.loan_because: If as little as $25 can help someone become more self sufficient and support their families, how can one not. I believe in doing as much as possible to try and make the world a better place. This is a good way to help others all around the world. It takes as many people as possible to join the cause to fight poverty, inequality, protect the environment, and human rights world wide.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage business accounts receiveables for a large corporation. I also volunteer to help abused/neglected kids express themselves through various art programs. I also plan on volunteering abroad someday.

lenders.name: Stefanie
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people any way I can. I am not wealthy but can surely spare enough money for these micro loans - often times, the same amount that I can easily spend for a meal out can be life changing to someone else in another part of the world.

lenders.name: Goodarz
lenders.loan_because: I believe Kiva provides a unique opportunity for us to alleviate poverty
lenders.occupational_info: doing research on preventing heart disease and strok

lenders.name: Margi
lenders.loan_because: I've been lucky in many areas, and I can share.  Wouldn't it be great if everyone who could would?

lenders.name: Sandy
lenders.loan_because: It's a great opportunity for me to offer help others and participate in people's lives all over the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in an operating room.  I set up the instruments and supplies needed and assist the surgeon during the surgery.

lenders.name: desi hrevatis
lenders.loan_because: this is not an act of charity.  this is a manifestation of my belief that, given the right tools, we are all equally capable.

lenders.name: Julia
lenders.loan_because:
2 Cor 9:6-11
Brothers and sisters, consider this:
whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly,
and whoever sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
Each must do as already determined, without sadness or compulsion,
for God loves a cheerful giver.
Moreover, God is able to make every grace abundant for you,
so that in all things, always having all you need,
you may have an abundance for every good work.
As it is written:

He scatters abroad, he gives to the poor;
his righteousness endures forever.

The one who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food
will supply and multiply your seed
and increase the harvest of your righteousness.

You are being enriched in every way for all generosity,
which through us produces thanksgiving to God.
lenders.occupational_info:
The art is my passion.  
A distributorship to sell golf equipment pays the bills.  My husband and I have been well blessed.   I am so grateful to have found the KIVA organization.

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: To give others a chance!
lenders.occupational_info: Manage a team of people!

lenders.name: Steve
lenders.loan_because: People helping people is simply better.
lenders.occupational_info: I publish educational curriculum for teaching children ages 2-12

lenders.name: Alex
lenders.loan_because: solidarity.
lenders.occupational_info: just a man

lenders.name: Terry
lenders.loan_because:
"We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give."
— Winston Churchill

 "Loan poor people money on terms that are suitable to them, teach them a few sound financial principles, and they will help themselves"  , Mohammad Yunus
lenders.occupational_info: RPCV Colombia '64-'66

lenders.name: Christine
lenders.loan_because: I have never forgotten what it was like to be poor as a Czech refugee child in Germany after WW II.  Our sponsor gave my family and I the chance to come to the U.S.  I want to give in that spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: My job is to care for chronically ill older people whose families cannot or do not wish to care for them at home, or for those who have no families.

lenders.name: Mary
lenders.loan_because: making a difference is an amazing amount of fun.
lenders.occupational_info: I serve as a religious leader for a community of 500 people. I visit the sick, conduct religious services, teach and provide counsel to those in need.

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because:
"Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world."
James 1:27

lenders.name: Danny
lenders.loan_because: I love all humans!

lenders.name: Brad
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy watching people grow and getting ahead.   I hope the little bit I can help goes a long way. I am encouraged by all these wonderful people working for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for California State Government.

lenders.name: shane
lenders.loan_because: I want to try this
lenders.occupational_info: I bring electricity into homes and businesses

lenders.name: Reanna
lenders.loan_because: My mummy wants me to learn about compassion and helping others.
